intro: Vellozia compacta var. obtusiflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf vellozia, is a striking member of the Restionaceae family native to South Africa. This plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen habit and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often densely clustered at the base. Its inflorescences consist of dense, spike-like clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers, which appear in spring. The plant is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
